column1: onci,$x_1$ is a soldier/warrior/fighter.,Not necessarily part of an army. Also do not see {sonci}.,fu'ivla,onci,
column2: onckire,$x_1$ wears 'on' (Japanese term) on $x_2$ due to $x_3$; $x_1$ is thankful/feels obligation/owes to $x_2$ due to $x_3$; $x_2$ is kind/grants favor/offers 'on' to $x_1$ in $x_3$; $x_1$ has unpayable debt to $x_2$ for $x_3$; $x_2$ is an 'onjin' (benefactor, Japanese term),In future lojban {ckire} might be equated with {onckire} and {nu ckire} with Japanese concept of 'on'.,fu'ivla,onckire,,have unpayable debt,wear 'on'
column3: ondatra,$x_1$ is a muskrat of species $x_2$,,fu'ivla,ondatra,,muskrat
column4: onga,$x_1$ (text) is written in a dialect where selbri in every bridi-tail is assumed to have {so'o'o'oi} applied to it,Implicit {so'o'o'oi} is not applied to other selbri like direct children of sumti and selbri rules, mex-operator, operand-3, free, tense-modal. '{sei} {onga}'/'{sei} {na} {onga}' is a method of switching to/from VSO-like style in Lojban. See also {colzu'e}.,fu'ivla,onga,
column5: ongu,$x_1$ is a bone in or originating from the body of $x_2$.,See also {bongu}.,fu'ivla,ongu,
column6: onji,$x_1$ is a kanji (Japanese logograph) with kun'yomi (native, Sino-Japanese reading) $x_2$, on'yomi (compound, Chinese reading) $x_3$, with etymology/meaning/radical/s $x_4$.,Merge of {ponjo} + .{anji}. Note that there may be many readings; x2 & x3 should be individual readings, not sets. In the rare case of no readings of particular type, {zi'o} should be used. x4 can be either a meaning, a fully specified set of meanings, a fully specified set of radicals, a single radical, the earlier form of the kanji, stroke order, or even the Chinese equivalent (taking into account that there are minor discrepancies between the Japanese and Chinese forms, and that the simplified Chinese characters are totally different).,fu'ivla,onji,,Han character,hanzi,kanji
column7: onkle,$x_1$ is an uncle of $x_2$,,fu'ivla,onkle,,uncle
column8: onmatopo'eia,$x_1$ is an onomatopoeia,,fu'ivla,onmatopo'eia,,onomatopoeia
column9: onskide,$x_1$ is a woodlouse/sowbug of family/genus $x_2$,see also {duntuplokra}, {boirlokra},fu'ivla,onskide,,sowbug,woodlouse
column10: ontari'o,$x_1$ reflects Ontario nationality/culture/geography in aspect $x_2$ (ka),,fu'ivla,ontari'o,,Ontarian,Ontario
column11: o'o cu'i,attitudinal:

column2: o'o nai,attitudinal:

opsalmo,$x_1$ is psalm about $x_2$,,fu'ivla,opsalmo,
column3: ordre,$x_1$ is a Linnaean order, between family and class,See {jutsi}, {klesi}, {jmive},fu'ivla,ordre,,order
column4: orgasme,$x_1$ feels orgasm, has orgasmic feeling,See also {gletu}, {entuzi}, {pluka}, {prami}.,fu'ivla,orgasme,
column5: orka,$x_1$ is an orca/killer whale (Orcinus orca) of breed $x_2$,,fu'ivla,orka,,killer whale,orca
column6: orne,$x_1$ is a pair (possibly ordered) of $x_2$ and $x_3$,For use in lujvo. See {remei}.,fu'ivla,orne,,pair
column7: ornitforinku,$x_1$ is a member of genus Ornithorhynchus (the Australian monotreme which is more commonly called "duck-billed platypus") of subtaxon/subclade $x_2$.,,fu'ivla,ornitforinku,,platypus
column8: orsi,$x_1$ is an ordered tuple/sequence of $x_2$ (li) members, namely $x_3$, $x_4$, $x_5$ ...,This brivla has 2 more arguments than the number specified as x2. x3, x4, x5... are in order. Useful for lujvo; can be used with a number, for example: {rely'orsi}.,fu'ivla,orsi,,sequence,tuple
column9: ortodoksi,$x_1$ is orthodox/has correct opinion in aspect $x_2$,See also {lijda}, {pajni}, {jinvi}, {miasno}, {krici},fu'ivla,ortodoksi,,orthodox
column10: orvalu,$x_{1}$ condenses/liquefies from vapour phase at temperature $x_{2}$, pressure $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is dew/condensate,See also {kelvo}, {paska}, {cilmo}, {dirgo}, {dunja}, {febvi}, {runme}, {gapci}, {bumru}.,fu'ivla,orvalu,,dew
column11: orvanxi,$x_1$ is broomrape of species $x_2$.,see also {rasykobli},fu'ivla,orvanxi,,broomrape
column12: orxo,$x_1$ is an orc of tribe/breed $x_2$,synonym {gorguni},fu'ivla,orxo,,orc,orch
column13: osmanlu,$x_1$ reflects Ottoman/Ottoman Turkish culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_2$,,fu'ivla,osmanlu,,Ottoman
column14: osna,$x_1$ is a mid back rounded vowel sound produced by $x_2$.,Synonym: {osnce}. Both are derived from and synonymous with {obu zei sance}.,fu'ivla,osna,,mid back rounded vowel,mid back rounded vowel sound,O sound
column15: osnce,$x_1$ is a mid back rounded vowel sound produced by $x_2$.,Synonym: {osna}. Both are derived from and synonymous with {obu zei sance}. The odd morphological form serves to place the most salient vowel in the stressed syllable.,fu'ivla,osnce,,mid back rounded vowel,mid back rounded vowel sound,O sound
column16: ostra,$x_1$ is an oyster of species $x_2$.,See also {luska},fu'ivla,ostra,,oyster
column17: otpala,$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of opal from source $x_2$,,fu'ivla,otpala,,opal
column19: oxtapodi,$x_1$ is an octopus of species $x_2$.,See also {tu'urbirka}.,fu'ivla,oxtapodi,,octopus
column20: oxtona,$x_1$ is a pika (member of lagomorph genus Ochotona) of subtaxon/type/species/variety/breed $x_2$,Meant for the genus of pikas Ochotona. Appropriately used, cannot include: rodents, shrews, elephant shrews; related to rabbits. The family Ochotonidai is presently known as monopyhletic. See also: {oxtonidai}, {ractu}.,fu'ivla,oxtona,,pika
column21: oxtonidai,$x_1$ is a pika (member of lagomorph family Ochotonidae) of subtaxon/type/genus/species/variety/breed $x_2$,This is for any member of the family (which presently has only one recognized genus). See also: {oxtona}. Appropriately used, does not include: rodents, shrews, elephant shrews; related to rabbits. See also: {ractu}.,fu'ivla,oxtonidai,,pika

column2: o'y,letteral for o.,Synonymous with the original CLL definition of .{obu}.,experimental cmavo,,,o,BY
column3: pa'a ku,sumti: explicitly marks respective use as in "THEY read THEIR (respective) books".,,cmavo-compound,,,each respectively,BAI*
column4: pa'a se va'u,among (with a share for each),,cmavo-compound,,,among,BAI*
column5: pa'au'o,digit/number: universal parabolic constant $P = √(2) + Log_e(1 + √(2)) ≈ 2.295587$,,experimental cmavo,,,,PA5
column6: pa bi,number/quantity: 18 [eighteen].,,cmavo-compound,,,18,PA*
column7: pa bi gei pa,number: $1*10^{18}$, exa, quintillion; symbol: E,,cmavo-compound,,,exa,quintillion
column8: pa ci,number/quantity: 13 [thirteen].,,cmavo-compound,,,13,PA*
column9: pagbu,$x_{1}$ is a part/component/piece/portion/segment of $x_{2}$ [where $x_{2}$ is a whole/mass]; $x_{2}$ is partly $x_{1}$.,Partly (= {selpau}).  See also cmavo list {pa'u}, {mulno}, {xadba}, {spisa}, {gunma}, {rafsi}.,gismu,pag,pau,pagb,pagbu,,part,,pa'u,se pa'u
column10: pagre,$x_{1}$ passes through/penetrates barrier/medium/portal $x_{2}$ to destination side $x_{3}$ from origin side $x_{4}$.,Passing through in both directions (= rolfargre, pagre ... .i so'ivo'ivo'u (and vice versa)).  See also {bitmu}, {denci}, {ganlo}, {kalri}, {vorme}, {pluta}, {canko}, {ragve}.,gismu,gre,pagr,pagre,,pass through
column11: pajni,$x_{1}$ judges/referees/arbitrates/is a judge determining/deciding matter $x_{2}$ (abstract).,$x_2$ includes jei = rule ({jetpai}), ni = estimate ({lairpai}), ka = evaluate ({kairpai} or {vampai}), or nu = referee/arbitrate ({faurpai}); single events of judging including specific decisions/judgements (= {paijdi}, {jetpaijdi}, {lairpaijdi}, {kairpaijdi}, {vampaijdi}, {faurpaijdi}); jury (= {pairkamni}), serve on a jury (= {kamnypai}, as part of mass $x_1$).  See also {cuxna}, {jdice}, {vajni}, {cipra}, {zekri}, {manri}, {mansa}.,gismu,pai,pajn,pajni,,judge
column12: palci,$x_{1}$ is evil/depraved/wicked [morally bad] by standard $x_{2}$.,See also {zekri}, {vrude}, {xlali}, {marde}, {mabla}.,gismu,pac,palc,palci,,evil
column13: palku,$x_{1}$ are pants/trousers/slacks/leggings [legged garment] of material $x_{2}$.,See also {taxfu}, {pastu}, {skaci}.,gismu,pak,palk,palku,,pants,slacks,trousers
column14: palne,$x_{1}$ is a tray/platter/flat container [pan/sheet/griddle] of contents $x_{2}$, and made of material $x_{3}$.,Also pallet, when used for carrying rather than support on the ground; a tray is flat-bottomed and shallow or without a rim, and is generally portable.  See also {tansi}, {patxu}, {palta}, {ckana}.,gismu,paln,palne,,tray
column15: palta,$x_{1}$ is a plate/dish/platter/saucer [flat/mildly concave food service bed] made of material $x_{2}$.,See also {ckana}, {palne}, {kabri}, {tansi}, {ckana}.,gismu,palt,palta,,plate
column16: pambe,$x_{1}$ is a pump/injector [tool/apparatus] pumping/inserting fluid $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ from $x_{4}$ by means $x_{5}$.,$x_2$ fluid may be liquid or gas; $x_5$ may be a force; a pump generally causes a pressure gradient, such that $x_3$ is a place of lower pressure, $x_4$ a place of higher pressure.  (cf. {gapci}, {litki}, {rinci}; metaphorical use of {fepri} for gas, {risna} for liquid, {rinci}, {tutci}),gismu,pamb,pambe,,pump

column2: pa'i,binary mathematical operator: ratio; [the ratio of a to b].,,cmavo,,,ratio,VUhU2
column3: pai,digit/number: pi (approximately 3.1416...); the constant defined by the ratio of the circumference to the diameter of all circles.,,cmavo,,,pi,PA5
column4: pagzu,$x_1$ participates in $x_2$ in manner $x_3$,Clipping of {pagzu'e},experimental gismu,pagzu,,participate
column5: palma,$x_1$ is a palm tree (Palmae/Arecaceae) of species $x_2$,Cf. {tricnrarekake}, {tricu}, {kokso}, {grasu}, {narge},experimental gismu,palma,,palm
column6: pamga,$x_1$ is a papaya (fruit) of species/variety/cultivar $x_2$,{rutrpaupau} is the non-experimental synonym of “pamga”. See also {grute}.,experimental gismu,pamga,,papaya
column7: pacycrida,$x_1$ is a demon,See also {pacru'i}.,lujvo,,,demon
column8: pacyselzu'e,$x_1$=$z_2$=$p_1$ is a sin/evil action by $x_2$=$z_1$ for purpose/goal $z_3$, evil/depraved/wicked (morally bad) by standerd $x_4$=$p_2$.,Cf. {jdazei}, {zekri}.,lujvo,,,evil action,sin
column9: pacyxlu,$xl_1$ (agent) tempts $xl_2$ into evil $xl_3$=$p_1$ by influence/threat/lure $xl_4$, said act being evil by standard $p_2$.,Cf. {xlura}, {palci}, {jdazei}.,lujvo,,,tempt
column10: pacyzu'e,$z_1$ sins by doing $z_2$=$p_1$ by standard $p_2$.,,lujvo,,
column11: padle'u,$x_1$ is punctuation in orthography/language $x_2$ representing $x_3$,$x_1$=$l_1$=$p_3$, $x_2$=$l_2$, $x_3$=$l_3$=$p_4$. See {pandi}, {lerfu},lujvo,,,punctuation
column12: pa'e nai,discursive:

column2: palpi,$x_1$ palpates/palps/touch-feels $x_2$ (surface structure),See {pencu}, {tengu}, {sefta}, {ganse},experimental gismu,palpi,,palpate,touch-feel
column3: pa'ercemci'e,$ci_1$=$p_1$ is a utopian society interrelated by structure $ci_2$.,Cf. {spocemci'e},lujvo,,,utopia
column4: pafcme,$p_1$=$c_1$ (quoted word(s)) is a/the patronymic [a personal name based on the name of one's father] of $p_2$=$c_2$ to/used-by namer/name-user $c_3$ (person).,See also: matronymic (={mamcme}).,lujvo,,,patronymic
column5: pafmamta,$x_1$ is a paternal grandmother of  $x_2$.,,lujvo,,,grandmother,paternal grandmother
column6: pafpa'u,$x_1$ is a paternal grandfather of  $x_2$.,,lujvo,,,grandfather,paternal grandfather
column7: pafy'utka,$x_1$ is patrilineal/agnatic to/an agnate of $x_2$; $x_1$ is path-connected to $x_2$ via the fatherhood relation, connected by a graph-path passing through intermediate relations/steps (successive agnates) $x_3$ (ce'o; ordered list).,$x_1$ is a father of the father of the father ... of the father of $x_2$. This word is a zi'evla lujvo ({brapagjvo}) of ".{utka}".,lujvo,,,agnate,agnatic,patrilineal
column8: pagygu'e,$p_1$=$g_1$ is a constituent country of $p_2$ (sovereign state / supranational body).,Cf. {gugde}, {zifyje'a}.,lujvo,,,constituent country
column9: pagzai,$x_1$=$z_1$ is a department store selling/trading (for) $x_2$=$z_2$, with departments $x_3$=$z_3$=$p_1$,from {pagbu} + {zarci},lujvo,,,department store
column10: pagzu'e,$x_1$ participates in $x_2$; $x_1$ takes part in $x_2$.,See also {pagbu}, {zukte}, {kansa}, {sidju}.,lujvo,,,participate,take part
column11: paijdi,$j_1$=$p_1$ gives a verdict $j_2$ (du'u) about matter $j_3$=$p_2$ (abstract).,Cf. {pajni}, {jdice}.,lujvo,,,adjudicate,arbitrate,give a verdict
column12: pairkamni,$p_1$=$k_1$ is a jury/judging panel deciding matter $p_2$ in court/judging body $k_3$.,,lujvo,,,judging panel,jury
column13: pairkamnycmi,$c_1$ is a member of jury/judging panel $c_2$=$p_1$=$k_1$ deciding matter $p_2$ in court/judging body $k_3$.,,lujvo,,,juror
column15: pairseljdi,$j_2$ is a verdict given by $j_1$=$p_1$ about matter $j_3$=$p_2$ (abstract).,Cf. {pajni}, {jdice}.,lujvo,,,finding,judgement,verdict
column16: pairtruci'e,$c_1$=$t_1$=$p_1$ is the judicial branch of the government of people/territory/domain/subjects $t_2$.,Cf. {pajni}, {turni}, {ciste}, {truci'e}, {zuktruci'e}, {flatruci'e}, {flacfatrugri}, {flazautrugri}, {vajraifla}.,lujvo,,,High Court,judicial branch,Supreme Court
column19: palpymlu,$x_1$ (object) feels like (via touch) it has property $x_2$ (ka) to $x_3$ (observer),,lujvo,,,feels like
column20: paltylu'i,$l_1$ (agent) washes dishes $l_2$ of soil/contaminant $l_3$ with cleaning material(s) $l_4$,Cf. {paltylumca'a}, {zbabu}, {ctitcilu'i}.,lujvo,,,dishwasher
column22: pamcinse,$c_1$ in activity/state $c_2$ exhibits romantic orientation $c_3$ (ka) by standard $c_4$.,,lujvo,,,affectional orientation,romantic orientation
column23: pamcro,$x_1$ experiences so-called 'heartache'/love-pain.,Possibly also includes love-sickness; so long as the experience is a psychological/emotional 'pain', anguish, grief, or other form of relatively intense discomfort derived from some form of love/limerence.,lujvo,,,heartache,love pain,love sickness
column24: pamcta,$c_1$=$p_1$ lovingly looks at/views/regards/watches/gazes at $c_2$=$p_2$,From la berenstein cribe 2020/11/17 See also {catlu}, {prami},lujvo,,
column25: pamjai,$j_1$ hugs/embraces $j_2$ with $j_3$ (part of $j_1$) at locus $j_4$ (part of $j_2$).,,lujvo,,,embrace,hug
column26: pamje'i,$x_1$=$j_1$ romantically pursues $x_2$=$j_2$.,Unlike {jersi}, implies volition for x1 but not necessarily x2. Does not imply "x1 pampe'o x2".,lujvo,,,pursue
column27: pamli'u,$p_1&p_2=l_1$ (mass) date via route $l_2$ using means $l_3$.,Cf. {litru}, {penmi}.,lujvo,,,date
column28: pagbrjonlapi,$x_1$ is a mereological object which underlaps with mereological object $x_2$ via at least object $x_3$ in universe of discourse $x_4$.,There exists an object $y$ in $x_4$ such that $x_1$ is a part of $y$, and $x_2$ is a part of $y$; moreover, $x_3$ is such a $y$ (but others may exist). Sometimes, this definition is restricted so that objects such that all things in the universe are part(s) of them are not candidates for $y$. See also: "{pagbrkuclapi}", "{pagbu}".,fu'ivla,pagbrjonlapi,,mereological underlap,underlap
column29: pagbrkuclapi,$x_1$ is a mereological object which overlaps with mereological object $x_2$ via at least object $x_3$ in universe of discourse $x_4$.,There exists an object $y$ in $x_4$ such that $y$ is a part of $x_1$, and $y$ is a part of $x_2$; moreover, $x_3$ is such a $y$. Sometimes, this definition is restricted so that objects which are parts of all things in the universe are not candidates for $y$. See also: "{pagbrjonlapi}", "{pagbu}", "{klesrverlapi}".,fu'ivla,pagbrkuclapi,,mereological overlap,overlap
column30: pakfiko,$x_1$ reflects/pertains to the Pacific Ocean region/culture/history/geography/identity/[nationality] in aspect $x_2$.,Pertains to peoples or things bordering, embedded in (or on an island in), submerged in, located under or on the bottom of, or going through/over the Pacific Ocean as well. "Trans-Pacific" is closely related to this word. See also: ".{atlanto}", ".{indi'o}", ".{antarktiko}".,fu'ivla,pakfiko,,Pacific Ocean
column31: palkane,$x_1$ is a quantity of methane,See {pa}, {alkane},fu'ivla,palkane,,methane
column32: palsita,$x_1$ is a Sith / Dark Jedi of power / level / rank $x_2$,,fu'ivla,palsita,,Dark Jedi,Sith
column33: palxima,$x_1$ is a unicycle/one-wheeled vehicle,Based on {pavyxilma'e}, but changing 'v' to 'l' for phonotactic reasons.,fu'ivla,palxima,,unicycle
column34: paf,Dad,The rafsi for {patfu} used as a familar name. See also {mam}, {bes}, {tix}, {bun}, {mes}.,cmevla,,,Dad,Daddy
column38: pai'e,scalar question: how very...?,Asks for NAhE. See http://mw.lojban.org/papri/zipcpi:_scalar_modifiers . See {pei'a}. Note: As many of the NAhE in this system are new and may be unfamiliar, NAI/CAI may be substituted for the answer instead.,experimental cmavo,,,scalar question,NAhE
column39: pai'i,Digit/number: pi (denoted "π"; approximately 3.1416...); the constant defined by the ratio of the circumference to the diameter of all circles in Euclidean space.,This word is intended to be an alternative to but synonymous with both "{pai}" as defined in the original Lojban baseline grammar, as well as the related proposed meaning of "{pi'au}". Consequent to the latter, it is part of a proposal to move "{pau}" to "{pai}" and "{poi'a}", "{noi'a}", "{soi'a}" to "{pau}", "{nau}", and "{sau}" resp. See also: "{tau'u}". For reference: "{tcekitau}", "{tcekitaujau}", "{tcekitaujei}";  https://mw.lojban.org/papri/ce_ki_tau_jau .,experimental cmavo,,,circle constant pi,pi,pi,PA5
column42: pa mei,quantified selbri: convert 1 to cardinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is a set with single/sole/only member $x_{2}$.,,cmavo-compound,,,is singular,single,MOI*
column43: pamniarkovni,$x_1$ is rational, prudent, judicious, level-headed with a limited ken (range of sight),Inspired by {pamrkovni} (to which it is synonymous) and its etymological ancestor (see Etymology section) without having such a strong implication of CVC(r)- (classifier rafsi prefix) morphology. See also: {stati}, {na} {certu},obsolete fu'ivla,pamniarkovni,,rational with a limited knowledge
column44: pa moi,quantified selbri: convert 1 to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is first among $x_{2}$ ordered by rule $x_{3}$.,,cmavo-compound,,,first,is first among,MOI*
column45: pa mo'o,discursive utterance ordinal: first section/chapter ordinal.,,cmavo-compound,,,section 1,MAI*
column46: panci,$x_{1}$ is an odor/fragrance/scent/smell emitted by $x_{2}$ and detected by observer/sensor $x_{3}$.,An undetected emitter is odorless to the observer.  See also {nazbi}, {sumne}, {cpina}, {vrusi}.,gismu,pan,panc,panci,,odor
column47: pandi,$x_{1}$ (agent) punctuates $x_{2}$ (expression) with symbol/word $x_{3}$ with syntactic/semantic effect $x_{4}$.,See also {lerfu}, {basna}, {denpa}.,gismu,pad,pand,pandi,,punctuate
column48: panje,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of sponge/porous material.,Also metaphorically used for coral, Swiss cheese.  See also {cokcu} for a generalized absorbant.,gismu,panj,panje,,sponge
column49: panka,$x_{1}$ is a park/land reserve managed by community/polity/company $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.,See also {sorcu}, {zdile}, {klaji}, {purdi}.,gismu,pank,panka,,park
column50: panlo,$x_{1}$ is a slice [thin flat portion] of $x_{2}$ (mass).,See also {spisa}, {pagbu}, {nanba}.,gismu,pa'o,panl,panlo,,slice
column51: panpi,$x_{1}$ is at peace with $x_{2}$.,(cf. {jamna}; use {sarxe}, {smaji}, {tugni} for most metaphorical extensions, {cilce}, {jamna}),gismu,pap,panp,panpi,,peace
column52: pante,$x_{1}$ protests/objects to/complains about $x_{2}$ (event/state) to audience $x_{3}$ with action $x_{4}$.,($x_4$ is an event or {tu'a} quotation) See also {xarnu}.,gismu,pat,pant,pante,,protest
column53: panzi,$x_{1}$ is a [biological] offspring/child/kid/hybrid of parent(s) $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is filial.,See also {grute}, {verba}, {bersa}, {tixnu}, se {rorci}, {patfu}.,gismu,paz,panz,panzi,,offspring
column54: papri,$x_{1}$ is a [physical] page/leaf of book/document/bound mass of pages $x_{2}$.,Numbered pages (as in a book) are the sides of a page (= {paprysfe}, {paprysfelai}); a pageful of text (= {papryseltcidu}, {paprytcidylai}).  See also {karni}, {pelji}, {prina}, {xatra}, {vreji}, {pezli}, {cukta}, {ciska}.,gismu,papr,papri,,page
column55: parbi,$x_{1}$ (me'o, fraction) is a ratio/rate of $x_{2}$ (quantity) with respect to $x_{3}$ (quantity), [$x_{2}$:$x_{3}$].,Also $x_1$ fraction/proportion/quotient; $x_2$ dividend/numerator; $x_3$ divisor/denominator.  See also {frinu}, {dilcu}, {mekso}.,gismu,pab,parb,parbi,,rate,ratio
column57: pardu,$x_1$ is a leopard of species $x_2$,See {bramlatu},experimental gismu,pardu,
column58: parji,$x_1$ is a parasite of $x_2$.,see also {civla}, {cipnrkuku}, {xidnora},experimental gismu,parji,,parasite
column59: pampe'i,$pe_1$ meets $pe_2$ for a date (planned romantic appointment) in/at location $pe_3$ for activity $x_4$,From {prami} {penmi},lujvo,,,date
column61: pamrulspa,$l_1$ is a lily of the Nile/African lily (genus Agapanthus) of species/strain $l_2$.,Agapanthus is greek for "love flower".,lujvo,,,African lily,lily of the Nile
column63: pamsi'u,$x_1$ love each other; $x_1$ are in love,{prami} {simxu},lujvo,,,in love

column84: panra,$x_{1}$ parallels $x_{2}$ differing only in property $x_{3}$ (ka; jo'u/fa'u term) by standard/geometry $x_{4}$.,Also: $x_1$ is parallel to $x_2$, $x_3$ is the only difference between $x_1$ and $x_2$ (= {terpanra} for reordered places); $x_1$ and $x_2$ are alike/similar/congruent.   A parallel involves extreme close similarity/correspondence across the entirety of the things being compared, generally involving multiple properties, with focus placed on one or a small number of differences. See also {pa'a}, {mintu}, {simsa}, {girzu}, {vrici}.,gismu,panr,panra,,parallel,,pa'a,se pa'a,te pa'a,ve pa'a
column85: panryki'i,$x_1$ and $x_2$ have or had (not necessarily simultaneously) the same relationship to $x_3$, that relationship being $x_4$, with the relevant difference(s) between $x_1$ and $x_2$ being $x_5$.,The (ordered) relationship which exists/existed(/will exist?) between $x_1$ and $x_3$ (in that order) is the same relationship, modulo difference $x_5$, which at some time exists/existed(/will exist?) between $x_2$ and $x_3$ (in that order). For differences in timing (for example: an ex-boyfriend and a current boyfriend of the same person were/are both boyfriends of that person - but not simultaneously; they are temporally-displaced co-boyfriends of that person, in a sense), mention that timing in $x_5$. This word can be used for co-partners in romantic relationships, 'sister wives' (co-spouses) in marriage to some common third individual(s), co-parents of shared children, etc. See also: "{glepanryborki'i}".,lujvo,,,parallel relationship,same relationship as
column86: panrykle,$x1$=$k1$ (mass/si'o) is an equivalence class within/is a substructure of  $x2$ (mathematical structure/object/category/set endowed with operations and properties) with defining characteristic/property/for similarity/under equivalence relation $x3$=$p3$, with representative member $x4$=$p1$=$p2$, in geometry/by standard/under paradigm $x5$=$p4$,x5 may have some overlap with x2. See also: {panra}, {klesi}, {terpanryziltolju'i}, {panryzilbri},lujvo,,,equivalence class,equivalence relation,representative of equivalence class
column88: panryzilbri,$x1$=$b2$=$p3$ is a (predicate) equivalence relationship/similarity/parallel with/between/among arguments (sequence(s)/set(s)) $x2$=$b3$=$p1$=$p2$, partitioning (with only empty intersection) set/structure $x3$=$p4$; elements of $x2$ are mutually similar in property $x1$ within structure $x3$; $x3$  is partitioned by $x1$ into equivalence classes (including) $x2$;,An equivalence relation is reflective, symmetric, and transitive.  Likewise for the first two terbri of {panra}.  Therefore, order of x2 is unimportant. See also: {panra}, {panrykle}, {terpanryziltolju'i},lujvo,,,equivalence class partitioning: the equivalence relation inducing the partitions,equivalence relation: emphasizes the relation over its features/the structure involved
column89: pa'oxra,$pi_1$ is a cross section/tomogram, a picture of slice $pa_1$=$pi_2$ of $pa_2$ made by $pi_3$ in medium $pi_4$.,{samterpli} pa'oxra = CAT scan. There is another kind of tomogram which may be better termed {tadmijyxra}.,lujvo,,,cross section,tomogram

column114: paska,$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ Pascal [metric unit] in pressure (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.,See also {danre}, {kelvo}, {mitre}, {gradu}, {centi}, {decti}, {dekto}, {femti}, {gigdo}, {gocti}, {gotro}, {kilto}, {megdo}, {mikri}, {milti}, {nanvi}, {petso}, {picti}, {terto}, {xatsi}, {xecto}, {xexso}, {zepti}, {zetro}.,experimental gismu,paska,,Pascal
column115: paxra,$x_1$ is a cross-section (substance viewed cross-sectionally) of object $x_2$ made from perspective/side/orientation/along (and perpendicular to) axis  $x_3$ (this determines the shape) and made in hyperplane/at depth/to contain/consisting of particular slice $x_4$ (this determines the size and content), of dimensionality $x_5$ [li; integer greater than -2, less than or equal to the dimensionality of $x_2$]; $x_1$ is the result and arranged content of the intersection of $x_2$ with an $(x_5) $-dimensional hyperplane that is perpendicular to axis $x_3$ and along it such that it has a depth (approximately $x_4$) in $x_2$ that allows it to contain a particular slice (of) $x_4$,This is not necessarily just a picture or perspective/image of a cross-section (use lujvo for that sense)- this would include MRI scans/images, tomography, etc.; it is really a(n idea copy of a) thin slice, in an abstract or mathematical sense, of the object $x_2$ itself (that slice need not actually be removed from the object; the object need not actually be cut). Use lujvo for effective cross-section due to fundamental physical interactions (so-called 'forces'; such as electromagnetism) as in the case of bombardment. Need not be two-dimensional. The substance/medium/consistency and arrangement of the cross-section is the same as that of the object in that particular slice. Microscope slides are included. If the object is $n$-dimensional and the dimensionality of the cross-section is not $n-1$, then the particular segment of the $(n-1)$-dimensional cross-section being particularly considered must be specified by $x_3$, $x_4$, and $x_5$.,experimental gismu,paxra,,cross section,cross-section,slide
column116: paznu,$x_1$ is a non-binary offspring/child of parent(s) $x_2$ [not necessarily biological]; $x_1$ is filial (but not a son or daughter).,See discussion associated with "{dinti}" concerning whether this meaning is restricted to "affirmatively nonbinary" or whether it is more general. Umbrella term for any non-male, non-female (in some aspect/consideration/standard) child/offspring. Specifies "{selrirni}", "{verba}", "{panzi}" so as to be co-equal with "{bersa}" and "{tixnu}". See also: "{verba}", "{nanla}", "{nixli}", "{nakni}", "{fetsi}", "{dinti}", "{vepre}", "{nunmu}", "{patfu}", "{mamta}", "{rirni}", "{preri}", "{bruna}", "{mensi}", "{tunba}", "{pentu}", "{rorci}", "{panzi}", "{bersa}", "{tixnu}".,experimental gismu,paznu,,non-binary offspring

column126: pa'uspe,$x_1$ is a step-parent via the father of $x_2$ due to marriage with the latter's father according to law/custom $x_3$, where said fatherhood is not necessarily biological.,$x_1$ does not necessarily raise $x_2$ (for such a purpose, append "{rirni}" vel sim. as a tertau). The gender of $x_1$ is not specified. See also: {mamspe}, {rirspe}, {spepa'u}.,lujvo,,,paternal step-father,paternal step-mother,paternal step-parent,paternalwise step-father,paternalwise step-parent,step-father,step-mother,step-parent

column131: pavdutcinse,$c_1$ is strictly heterosexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.,This word does not apply to bisexuals and is the direct Lojban equivalent of English "heterosexual". Cf. {pavycinse}, {dutcinse}, {pavmitcinse}.,lujvo,,,heterosexual,heterosexual female,heterosexual male,strict heterosexual

column136: pavmau,$x_1$ is greater than the multiplicative identity; $x_1$ expands/dilates/scales up something when multiplying it.,This is a multiplicative sense of "positive".,lujvo,,,dilation factor,greater than 1,multiplicatively positive number

column140: pavmoidei,$x_1$ is $x_2$=$d_2$ (default: 1) first days of a set of days (week, month, year) $x_3$=$m_2$ ordered by rule $x_4$=$m_3$ and being a day by standard $x_5$=$d_3$,When the set entered is a week, the meaning becomes monday. See {pa}, {moi} and {djedi}.,lujvo,,,first day,first member of a set of days,monday
column141: pavmoinavni,$x1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of helium (He; the first noble gas),,lujvo,,,helium
column142: pavmombesy'utka,$x_1$ is path-connected to $x_2$ via the male-only first-born progeny/primogeniture relation; $x_1$ is the first-born son of the first-born son of ... the first-born son of $x_2$, connected by a graph-path passing through intermediate relations/steps (successive first-born sons) $x_3$ (ce'o; ordered list).,Not necessarily restricted to only males iff the case can be made of male-filial relation despite gender; $x_2$ need not be male. Will typically be restricted to biological or adoptive relations (otherwise, what is the point/what does the word mean?). Append with seltau "{sarcu}" for qualified/conditional primogenture; append with tertau "{cerda}" in order to reference primogeniturial inheritance.,lujvo,,,male-only primogeniture,primogeniture
column143: pavmompazy'utka,$x_1$ is path-connected to $x_2$ via the (non-gendered/absolute) first-born progeny/primogeniture relation; $x_1$ is the first-born offspring of the first-born offspring of ... the first-born offspring of $x_2$, connected by a graph-path passing through intermediate relations/steps (successive first-born offspring) $x_3$ (ce'o; ordered list), "first" being according to ordering rule $x_4$ (default, as used in this definition: chronological order of birth; restrictions on legitimacy etc. may also be included here).,Despite the definition saying "first-born" repeatedly, other orderings may be specified by $x_4$, in which case "firstness" is according to the specified rules (and applies to $x_1$ and the members of $x_3$ (but not necessarily $x_2$) each in turn for their generation and lineage (in other words: each of child will be the 'first' child of the previous member, until but not necessarily including $x_2$, where "firstness" is as defined; importantly, the "firstness" relation will not be compared across generations (it renews with each generation) or across lineages - it is a partial ordering). This word's usage will typically be restricted to biological relations (otherwise, what is the point/what does the word mean? Additionally, "{panzi}" is seemingly restrictive in this regard). Append with seltau "{sarcu}" for qualified/conditional primogenture; append with tertau "{cerda}" in order to reference primogeniturial inheritance.,lujvo,,,first-born,primogeniture
column144: pavmompazy'utka'au'ypanzi,$x_1$ is any child of the first child of the first child of ... the first child of $x_2$, where the graph geodesic through the ancestorship-directed family tree from $x_1$ to $x_2$ is of length $(x_3) + 1$ (li; $x_3$ must be a nonnegative integer or positive infinity), and where "first" is according to (partial) ordering rule $x_4$ (default: chronological order of birth per successive generation within the given lineage; other restrictions on legitimacy etc. may be specified here as well).,Respects the direction (possibly asymmetry) of the relation so that the graph geodesic distance from A to B may not equal that of from B to A (and either of them may not be defined at all or may be infinite); path-linking is as in ".{utka}". Other properties are as in or analogous to those of "{pavmompazy'utka'ypanzi}". Due to restrictions on $x_3$, $x_1$ and $x_2$ must be mutually distinct. As an example: If Queen Elizabeth II of the UK/Commonwealth is $x_2$ and chronological order of birth for legitimate children (gender-neutral primogeniture on legitimate descent) is used as $x_4$, then the set of possible $x_1$s includes (and, as of 9 May A.D. 2019, is equal to the set of) all of the children of Elizabeth II, the legitimate children of her son Charles (William, Harry), and all of William's children (George, Charlotte, Louis); notice that the descendants of Elizabeth II not via Charles are excluded, as are any descendants not by William (including Harry's children); the next generation of possible $x_1$s will be (supposing that they come to exist) the children of George (the first-born legitimate son of William first-born legitimate son of Charles first-born legitimate son of Queen Elizabeth II) but not the descendants of William not by George; the fact that all of the intermediate steps are male is mere coincidence; this selbri in this example is a generalization of how the title "prince" is automatically bestowed in this line (excluding by marriage), at present, except for those who are granted princehood by virtue of being the children of the sons of the sovereign - in particular, if "{su'e} {re}" is submitted as $x_3$, then the rules match at present (with the aforementioned exception) because the automatic granting of the title halts with the children of William (who possess the longest possible graph geodesics to the queen by this relation).,lujvo,,,child of primogenitic line of length n
column145: pavmompazy'utka'ypanzi,$x_1$ is any child of the first child of the first child of ... the first child of $x_2$, with intermediate steps $x_3$ (complete ordered list, "ce'o"; should include the relevant parent of $x_1$), where "first" is according to (partial) ordering rule $x_4$ (default: chronological order of birth per successive generation within the given lineage; other restrictions on legitimacy etc. may be specified here as well).,The children of $x_2$ are valid candidates for $x_1$ due to trivial contraction of the relation. As an example: if Queen Elizabeth II of the UK/Commonwealth is $x_2$ and chronological order of birth for legitimate children (gender-neutral primogeniture on legitimate descent) is used as $x_4$, then the set of possible $x_1$s includes (and, as of 9 May A.D. 2019, is equal to the set of) all of the children of Elizabeth II, the legitimate children of her son Charles (William, Harry), and all of William's children (George, Charlotte, Louis); notice that the descendants of Elizabeth II not via Charles are excluded, as are any descendants not by William (including Harry's children); the next generation of possible $x_1$s will be (supposing that they come to exist) the children of George (the first-born legitimate son of William first-born legitimate son of Charles first-born legitimate son of Queen Elizabeth II) but not the descendants of William not by George; the fact that all of the intermediate steps are male is mere coincidence; this selbri in this example is a generalization of how the title "prince" is automatically bestowed in this line (excluding by marriage), at present, except for those who are granted princehood by virtue of being the children of the sons of the sovereign. (Technically, in at least some contexts, $x_3$ would have to be deleted or made variable in order to specify all such princes because any given sequence of intermediate steps, even if elliptical, will essentially uniquely specify the parent of $x_1$). See: "{pavmompazy'utka}".,lujvo,,,child of primogenitic line
column146: pavmomtixy'utka,$x_1$ is path-connected to $x_2$ via the female-only first-born progeny/primogeniture relation; $x_1$ is the first-born daughter of the first-born daughter of ... the first-born daughter of $x_2$, connected by a graph-path passing through intermediate relations/steps (successive first-born daughters) $x_3$ (ce'o; ordered list).,Not necessarily restricted to only females iff the case can be made of female-filial/thygatric/daughterial relation despite gender; $x_2$ need not be female. Will typically be restricted to biological or adoptive relations (otherwise, what is the point/what does the word mean?). Append with seltau "{sarcu}" for qualified/conditional primogenture; append with tertau "{cerda}" in order to reference primogeniturial inheritance.,lujvo,,,female-only primogeniture,primogeniture
column147: pavmudblo,$x_1$ is a dugout for carrying $x_2$,from {pa} + {mudri} + {bloti},lujvo,,,dugout
column148: pavnondugri,$d_1$ is the common logarithm (base 10) of $d_2$.,Synonymous to {dekydugri}. See also {te'o zei dugri}, {reldugri}, {dugri}.,lujvo,,,Briggsian logarithm,common logarithm,decadic logarithm,decimal logarithm
column149: pavnonma'i,$x_1$ is October/the tenth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.,,lujvo,,,October,Tevet

Based on STANAG 2116: NATO Codes for Grades of Military Personnel.,lujvo,,,Admiral of the Fleet,Field Marshal,Fleet Admiral,General of the Air Force,General of the Army,Marshal of the Indian Air Force,Marshal of the Royal Air Force

column160: pavycinse,$c_1$ is monosexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.,Monosexual means sexual interest in only one sex/gender, so this word does not apply to bisexuals (= {relcinse}). Cf. {fetcinse}, {nakcinse}, {mitcinse}, {dutcinse}.,lujvo,,,monosexual

column162: pavyfautci,$x_1$ is a single-use/one-time tool/utensil/resource/implement used for doing $x_2$ (and discarded afterward).,From {pavyfau} {tutci}. Synonyms: {pavyfauselpli}, {pavyplitci}. See also {festerplatci} 'disposable tool', {festerplakai} 'be disposable'.,lujvo,,,disposable utensil,one-time tool,one-time utensil,single-use implement,single-use resource,single-use tool,single-use utensil
column163: pavyfu'ivla,$x_1$=$v_1$=$f_1$ is a stage 1 fu'ivla meaning $x_2$=$v_2$, based on word $x_3$=$f_2$ in language $x_4$.,'stage 1 fu'ivla' is a term specific to Lojban and described in 'The Complete Lojban Language', chapter 4, section 7. The definition is similar to that of {fu'ivla}, but with the x3 place of {fu'ivla} omitted. x1 is assumed to be a Lojban quote including text of any language (see example) as the concept doesn't make much sense for other languages. See also {relfu'ivla} - 'stage 2 fu'ivla', {cibyfu'ivla} - 'stage 3 fu'ivla' and {vonfu'ivla} - 'stage 4 fu'ivla',lujvo,,,stage 1 fu'ivla

column176: pavysmi,$x1$ is the one(-like) element/multiplicative identity of structure/ring $x2$; often is denoted by  ' $1_R$ ' or  ' $I_R$  ' or by  (when context is obvious)  '1' or 'I', for structure/ring R (given by $x2$).,Definition and rules may be specified in the second terbri; this definition does not suppose that the ring is not the 0-ring  (the trivial ring) with the mapping of all multiplications to 0 (in which case, the additive identity is also the multiplicative identity). The usage of "additive" and "multiplicative" in this context are defined by the ring. The n×n identity matrix over a given ring is an example of one such element. See also: {nonsmi},lujvo,,,multiplicative identity,one-like element

column204: pasnce,$x_1$ is a voiceless bilabial stop sound produced by $x_2$.,Derived from and synonymous with {py zei sance}. The odd morphological form serves to place the most salient consonant in the stressed syllable.,fu'ivla,pasnce,,P sound,voiceless bilabial plosive,voiceless bilabial stop,voiceless bilabial stop sound
column205: pasrtunika,$x_1$ is a tunic of material $x_2$.,A garment worn over the torso, with or without sleeves, and of various lengths reaching from the hips to the ankles. Originated in Greece and Ancien Rome. {tu'inka} for type 4. Cf. {pastu}.,fu'ivla,pasrtunika,,tunic
column207: paugbu,$x_1$ (plural) each satisfying $x_2$ (ka), one by one, is how $x_3$ (nu) is brought about.,Defined so that "{fi'o} {paugbu} ..." = "one ... at a time". ($x_3$ should describe the "gestalt action" formed by all the individual actions of $x_2$ being done to the $x_1$s one at a time.) See {pau'u}.,fu'ivla,paugbu,
column208: paulcna,$x_1$ [signed quantity] is the the intrinsic spin/signed spin quantum number/magnetic quantum number/Dirac-Pauli spin-like charge [commonly denoted: $s$] of particle/thing $x_2$, as measured along axis/in direction/measuring component $x_3$,Contextless default for x3 is probably along the z-axis in the positive direction or any axis at all. For an electron, this quantity has absolute value of hbar/2 [the Lojban ignores the technical issue in English of "spin" versus "spin quantum number"]. Pay attention to the fact that {plankexu} is defined as equalling hbar/2, not just hbar. See also: {plankexu}.,fu'ivla,paulcna,,Dirac-Pauli charge,intrinsic spin,spin
column209: pavjima,$x_1$ is a unicorn of type/mythology $x_2$,Syn. {pavyseljirna}. See {pa}, {jirna}, {xirma}, {na'irxi'a},fu'ivla,pavjima,,unicorn

Based on STANAG 2116: NATO Codes for Grades of Military Personnel.,lujvo,,,1st Lieutenant,Flying Officer,Lieutenant,Lieutenant - Junior Grade,Sub-Lieutenant

column1: {pau'ainai} - genuine/serious/literal assertion/question/command marker,Place after an interrogative word (such as {xu}, {ma}, {mo}, etc.) in order to indicate that a question (and, in particular, that construct) is being presented rhetorically with no actual desire for an answer (except one that plays along with the purpose). Place after an imperative construct (such as {ko}) in order to rhetorically command the audience- such as with the English sentence "Tell me about it", which actually indicates emphatic and personal agreement rather than a command/request for the details to be explicated or elaborated. Various grammatical structures can be marked as rhetorical flourishes this way; in this capacity, the word might (but need not) operate in a way similar to {pe'a} (such as with, maybe, the phrase "for forty days and forty nights" meaning that some event had a long duration and the utterer wishes to reference/bring to mind the Biblical story of Noah's Flood in some way). Of course, whole bridi can be marked by this word. In general, it elevates the understanding of an utterance from literal to something with a purpose or intent and which may not be entirely factual or genuine but, rather, which is being used a tool in the design of a presentation. This word's negative makes it clear that the utterance is to be understood literally or as a genuine, face-value piece of text (although figurative language may still be present- it is only literal in its presentation, so to speak). See also: {si'ai},experimental cmavo,,,rhetorical marker,UI
column2: pau'a'u,mekso operator: part of number/projection (one sense); the X2 part of X1,X1 can be a tensor, in which case the operator applies entry-wise; X1 can be a function, in which case the operator applies pointwise. It extracts the part of the number that belongs to the structure X2 united with the singleton 0. X2 = R implies "real part"; X2 = i*R implies "imaginary part"; X2 = R+ implies "positive part"; X2 = R- implies "negatige part". If X1 has no explicit value/projection in/along X2, then the output is 0. If 0 is X1 or X2, then the output is 0. X1 should really be a structure, not just a set.,experimental cmavo,,,part of number,projection,VUhU
column3: pau'au,ternary mekso operator: p-adic valuation; outputs (positive) infinity if $x_1 = 0$ and, else, outputs sup$($Set($k: k$ is a nonnegative integer, and $((1 - x_3)x_2 + x_3 p_{x_2})^k$ divides $x_1))$, where $p_n$ is the $n$th prime (such that $p_1 = 2$).,The terbri order here was defined in analogy to "{de'o}". Normally, $x_1$ should be a rational number, and $x_2$ should be a positive integer; some generalizations may be possible, though. $x_3$ is either $0$ xor $1$, and indicates/toggles between modes: $x_3 = 0$ yields the $x_2$-adic valuation (even for nonprime $x_2$); $x_3 = 1$ yields the $p_{x_2}$-adic valuation. $x_2 = 1, x_3 = 0$ yields positive infinity for any $x_1$ which is within the domain. If $x_1 = n/m$ and is a rational noninteger number such that gcd$(n,m) = 1$, then pau'au$(x_1, x_2, x_3) =$ pau'au$(n, x_2, x_3) -$ pau'au$(m, x_2, x_3)$. See also: "{fei'i}", "{pi'ei'oi}". This word is often equivalent to or closely related to "{pei'e'a}" (which is, in some ways, more general but also is less flexible with respect to its input).,experimental cmavo,,,exponent of factors,integer exponent,maximum exponent of factor,p-adic order,p-adic valuation,prime-logarithm,VUhU3
column4: pau'ei,mekso operator: power set - produces the set of all subsets of set $X_1$ that are of (any) size (that is) $X_2$ [a nonnegative integer or transfinite/infinite number; default: su'o no].,Possibly also could be used as a nonlogical "connective" of sorts. For accessing more than one cardinality in $X_2$, use modifiers ("less than"/"greater than") or vague numbers; default: "su'o no", which outputs the set of all subsets of $X_1$; thus, the unary operator is just the standard power set operator.,experimental cmavo,,,power set operator,VUhU
column5: pau'i,discursive: marks the previous construction as a question, with valid responses being any construction which could replace it without changing the grammar of the overall utterance.,Used if you don't know the question word for the class you wish to ask about. {fu'e}...{fu'o} can be used to explicitly declare the scope of the question. See {pau}.,experimental cmavo,,,,UI

See also: "{dinti}", "{nunmu}", "{tunba}", "{mensi}", "{bruna}", "{tamne}", "{famti}".,experimental gismu,pentu,,non-binary sibling
column33: pevna,$x_1$: its qualities are represented as a metaphor $x_2$ in dimension $x_{3+1,2}$,$x_3$ can include references to $x_1$ and $x_2$. See {pe'a}, {sidysmu}, {tanru}, {metfo}, {ve} {lujvo}, {cimjvo},experimental gismu,pevna,,to be metaphorically described
column35: pazypanzi,$x_1$ is a grandchild of $x_2$.,Synonymous to “se {riryrirni}”.,lujvo,,,grandchild
column36: pazyprasimka'e,$x_1$ (individual, mass, or population (set?)) and $x_2$ (individual, mass, or population (set?)) are capable of mutually interbreeding/producing offspring with one another.,This word is symmetric under exchange of $x_1$ with $x_2$ (conversion by "se"). $x_1$ need not be able to or actually fulfill the same roles in reproduction as $x_2$ or vice-versa; actual instances of reproduction need not occur/be realized. The standard for what constitutes ability to interbreed (is it just genetics? Do physiological/anatomical features restricting, say, gestation and successful birth matter? Must the populations actually know of one another?) is ambiguous and left unspecified.,lujvo,,,interbreedable
column37: pazyprasi'u,$x_1$ (set) is composed of members which interbreed with one another.,This statement does not merely say that they *can* mutually interbreed, but that they *do*. It is uncertain whether it would be acceptable to use this word in reference to a set of cardinality greater than two in binary-sexed sexual species (for example: a set of two women and one man may be said to internally interbreed if the man breeds with each woman, but the women would be incapable of breeding with one another).,lujvo,,,interbreed
column38: pecpu'a,$x_1$ is pleasant to the touch / feels good to touch, to $x_2$,,lujvo,,,good feeling,pleasant
column39: pecrufcpina,The feel/texture of $c_1$=$r_1$=$p_2$ is hair-raising/sets one's teeth on edge/squicks/gives the willies/heebie-jeebies to $p_1$, who touches it with $p_3$ [a locus on $p_1$ or an instrument] at $p_4$ [a locus on $c_1$=$r_1$=$p_2$].,The unpleasant feeling induced is the same as that in {tinmosycpina}, but caused by touch rather than hearing.,lujvo,,
column41: pedy'utka,$x_1$ is a friend of a friend of ... a friend of $x_2$ (experiencer), path-connected by the directed friendship relationship via intermediate nodes (friends) $x_3$ (list; ce'o).,No friendship relation is necessarily symmetric. This word is a {brapagjvo} using {zevla} ".{utka}". Slightly shorter than "{pendy'utka}", which is semantically equivalent.,lujvo,,,friend of a friend,friend of a friend of a friend ...
column42: pegyuenzi,$x_1$ is a text matching PEG rule $x_3$, resulting in output $x_2$,See {gentufa}, {pegjva},lujvo,,
column43: peifli,$x_1$=$f_1$=$p_1$ is baffled/befuddled/perplexed/flummoxed by subject $x_2$=$p_2$; $x_1$=$f_1$=$p_1$ is stuck on problem $x_2$=$p_2$.,,lujvo,,,baffled,befuddled,bewildered,flummoxed,perplexed,stuck
column44: peipre,$pr_1$=$pe_1$ is an intellectual thinking thoughts/reflecting upon $pe_2$.,,lujvo,,,intellectual
column45: peisku,$p_1$=$c_1$ thinks thought $c_2$=$p_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept).,Verbal or near-verbal expression of a thought; internal monologue.  Made from {pensi} + {cusku}.,lujvo,,,have thought,think
column46: peixru,$x_1$=$p_1$ thinks back to origin/earlier state $x_3$ about $p_2$ (abstraction).,Cf. {pensi}, {xruti}, {morji}.,lujvo,,,go back,return,think back
column48: peldei,$x_1$ is Tuesday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.,Synonyms: {fagdei}, {reldei}. See also {najdei}, {ri'odje}.,lujvo,,,Tuesday
column49: peldjasluni,$x_1$  is a yellow onion (Allium cepa) of variety/breed $x_2$.,See also common onion (={djasluni}).,lujvo,,,yellow onion
column50: pelnimre,$x_1$ is a lemon of variety $x_2$.,Cf. {pelxu}, {nimre}, {ri'ornimre}, {najnimre}, {branimre}, {nimre}.,lujvo,,,lemon
column51: pelnimryjisra,$j_1$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of lemon juice made from lemon/lemons $j_2$=$n_1$.,See also: {pelnimre}, {jisra}, {pelxu}, {nimre},lujvo,,,lemon juice
column52: pelri'o,$x_1$ is lime [color adjective].,Color between yellow (={pelxu}) and green (={crino}).,lujvo,,,lime,lime green,lime-green
column53: pelsmela,$x_1$ is an apricot [fruit] of species/variety $x_2$,Cf. {smela},lujvo,,,apricot
column54: pelylatna,$l_1$ is a American lotus/yellow lotus/water-chinquapin/volée, plant/flower/herb of species/strain $l_2$.,The Linnaean binomial Nelumbo lutea (Willd.) is the currently recognized name for this species, which has been classified under the former names Nelumbium luteum and Nelumbo pentapetala, among others.,lujvo,,,American lotus,volée,water-chinquapin,yellow lotus
column55: pelzilska,$x_1$ is the abstract color yellow,The gismu {pelxu} refers to objects which are yellow, but not the color yellow itself.  This lujvo serves the latter purpose.  See also {skari} {zilska},lujvo,,,yellow
column56: pejypoici'a zei uidje,$u_1$=$pr_1$ is a combo box with text $c_2$ and list [ordered set] $po_1$ in user interface $u_2$.,A combo box combines the capabilities of text fields (={ciska zei uidje}) and drop-down lists (={pejypoi zei uidje}). See also widget (={uidje}).,zei-lujvo,,,combo box
column57: pejypoi zei uidje,$u_1$=$pr_1$ is a drop-down list with list [ordered set] $po_1$ in user interface $u_2$.,List box (={porsi zei uidje}), combo box (={pejypoici'a zei uidje}), widget (={uidje}).,zei-lujvo,,,drop-down list
column58: peglfi,$x_1$ is a PEG rule that consumes the same input as $x_3$, but produces the output of $x_3$ mapped with function $x_2$,See {pegjva},fu'ivla,peglfi,
column59: pegnpe,$x_1$ is a PEG positive lookahead matching rule $x_2$,See {pegjva}, {pegnaka},fu'ivla,pegnpe,
column60: pegrke'u,$x_1$ is a PEG rule matching at least zero repetitions of rule $x_2$ and returning a sequence of any match results,See {pegjva}, {pegrsu'o}, {pegrsu'e},fu'ivla,pegrke'u,
column61: pegrsto,$x_1$ is a PEG rule whose input and output is the constant $x_2$,See {pegjva}, {porfedi},fu'ivla,pegrsto,
column62: pegrsu'o,$x_1$ is a PEG rule matching at least one repetition of rule $x_2$ and returning a sequence of the match results,See {pegjva}, {pegrke'u}, {pegrsu'e},fu'ivla,pegrsu'o,
column63: pe'ai,discursive: layperson/laïc meaning;  marks a construct as layperson/common/non-technical/non-jargon speech/text,Similar, but not equivalent, to {pe'a} and {sa'enai}.  If a construct could be interpreted in a technical sense (such as the word "likelihood" in English in the field of statistics) but is not being used in that technical sense, it may be marked for layperson interpretation by this word. See also: {pe'ainai}.,experimental cmavo,,,laic,layperson,UI3c
column64: pe'ai nai,technical meaning; marks a construct as jargon/terminology/technical/precise/exact speech/text,Marks how a construct is to be interpreted/understood.  Similar, but not equivalent, to {pe'anai} and {sa'e}. If a construct should/could be interpreted in a technical sense (such as the word "likelihood" in English in the field of statistics) AND is actually being used in that technical sense (rather than in a layperson sense), it may be marked for technical interpretation by this word. See also: {pe'ai},cmavo-compound,,,jargon,technical,technically speaking,UI3c
column65: pe'a nai,literal sense; marks a construct as literal (non-figurative/non-metaphorical/exact) speech/text,"Literally"; one sense of "exactly speaking".  Not to be used as an intensifier (unlike some usages of "literally" in English).,cmavo-compound,,,literal,UI3c
column66: pecyvidni,$v_1$ is a touchscreen serving function $v_2$.,Cf. {pencu}, {vidni}.,lujvo,,,touchscreen
column67: pedysi'u,$x_1$ are friends (of each other, distributively),This is the {jvajvo} version of {simpe'o}. cf {pendo} and {simxu},lujvo,,,friend
column68: pegjva,$x_1$ is a rule that can be used in a Parsing Expression Grammar (PEG),$x_1$'s first argument is the input text, its second argument is the parser's output, and its third one is the remainder of the text that the parser will process when done with this rule. Related: {pegyuenzi}, {peglfi}, {pegrsto}, {pegrpoi}, {pegnpe}, {pegnaka}, {pegrcu'a}, {pegrke'u}, {pegrsu'o}, {pegrsu'e},lujvo,,,PEG rule
column69: pe'ansmu,$x_1$ is a figurative/metaphorical meaning of $x_2$ seen by $x_3$,,fu'ivla,pe'ansmu,,figurative meaning
column70: pe'a ru'e,weak metaphor marker: indicates that there is some broadening of the concept, typically to include objects of types that are unusual for the defined place structure, but which retains most of the semantic of the word as defined.,See {pe'a}, {ru'e}, {do'a}. See the Lojban definitions for {dimnu'e} and {tcimi'e} for examples.,cmavo-compound,,,weak metaphor,UI3c*
column71: pebyuidje,$x_1$ is a text cursor (computer graphical element) of user interface $x_2$,From {penbi} + {uidje},lujvo,,,cursor
column72: pe cai,restrictive relative phrase marker: permanently / inalienably associated with; it is impossible or near-impossible to break that relation,Proposed as a variation of {po'e} with less semantic-boundary difficulties, while freeing up {po'e} for reassignment in dialects/forks. Most words that the concept of 'inalienable possession' applies to, e.g. {birka}, {mamta}, or even {pendo} in some natlangs, have a convenient {be} place to be used instead with a better-defined meaning. However, this may be used for any relation that is impossible-or-nigh-impossible to break, e.g. the car you worked on and made custom modifications to for years; in a sense, it will still be "your car" even if you sold it. {do'e}{cai} could be a variation to associate a bridi or the subject of the bridi, e.g. 'ti karce do'ecai mi'. See also {pesai}, {pe},cmavo-compound,,,permanently associated with,GOI*
column73: pemcku,$c_1$ is a book containing poem/verse $c_2$=$p_1$ by book author $c_3$ to book’s audience $c_4$ preserved in medium $c_5$.,,lujvo,,
column74: pempau,$pa_1$ is a verse of poem $pe_1$ about subject $pe_2$ by author $pe_3$ for intended audience $pe_4$.,Cf. {pemci}, {pagbu}, {vlali'i}, {vlagri}.,lujvo,,,stanza,verse
column75: pendy'utka,$x_1$ is a friend of a friend of ... a friend of $x_2$ (experiencer), path-connected by the directed friendship relationship via intermediate nodes (friends) $x_3$ (list; ce'o).,No friendship relation is necessarily symmetric. This word is a {brapagjvo} using {zevla} ".{utka}".,lujvo,,,friend of a friend,friend of a friend of a friend ...
column77: pengri,$g_1$ is a group meeting showing common property $g_2$ at/in location $p_3$.,,lujvo,,,group meeting
column79: penske,$x_1$ is a (so-called) science for socialization/matching/meeting between subjects $x_2$ in context/for purpose $x_3$, using methods $x_4$.,Basically, what eHarmony claims to do.,lujvo,,,matching science
column80: pensku,$x_1$ thinks thought / verbally thinks $x_2$ (quote),Contraction of pensysku. This word does not follow the usual lujvo rules.,lujvo,,,think thought,think verbally
column81: pe'ocni,$x_1$ feels friendship towards $x_2$,See also {pendo}, {cinmo}.,lujvo,,,feel friendship
column82: permudri,$p_1$=$m_1$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains pear wood/lumber of type $p_2$=$m_2$.,,lujvo,,,pear wood
column83: pertamca,$t_1$ is a pear tomato of variety/strain $t_2$.,,lujvo,,,pear tomato
column84: pertergu'i,$x_1$ is a light bulb illuminating $x_2$ with light $x_3$,,lujvo,,,light bulb
column85: pertricu,$s_1$ is a pear tree (genus Pyrus) of species/cultivar $s_2$.,,lujvo,,,pear tree
column87: pesru'e,$x_1 =$ pr$_1$ is cognition (process of thought) with inputs $x_2 =$ pr$_2$, outputs $x_3 =$ pr$_3 =$ pe$_2$, passing through stages $x_4 =$ pr$_4$, performed by $x_5 =$ pe$_1$.,Confer: "{puvypei}", "{nunpei}", "{selpei}", "{sidbo}", "{ganse}", "{sanji}".,lujvo,,,cognition
column88: pesti'i,$s_1$=$p_1$ hypothesizes $s_2$=$p_2$ to audience $s_3$ about subject/concept $x_4$=$p_2$.,Cf. {pensi}, {stidi}, {je'urja'o}.,lujvo,,,hypothesize
column89: pesymiste,$x_1$=$m_1$=$p_1$ is a pessimist, with thoughts $x_2$=$m_2$=$p_2$.,u'ivla, and the source of {miste}.,lujvo,,
column90: pesyske,$s_1$ is cognitive science/cognitive psychology, of/about subject matter $s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.,Distinct from neuroscience ({benske}). Encompasses any scientific discipline studying cognition (not necessarily human cognition), and, perhaps, also subfields of philosophy concerned with the nature of reasoning.,lujvo,,,cognitive psychology,cognitive science
column91: pevjifpedvla,$x_1$ is a "false friend" (word in different language that looks or sounds similar, but differs significantly in meaning) to $x_2$, meaning $x_3$ in language $x_4$.,Synonymous to {jifpedvla}. See {valsi}, {smuni}, {bangu}.,lujvo,,,false friend
column93: pevycikna,$x_1$=$c_1$ is "woke" to/aware of $x_2$,A translation of the informal American English "woke". Caution: it's extremely {malgli} and may be misconstrued by non-{gliselbau}. x2 can be a societal injustice or some other pressing issues.,lujvo,,,woke
column94: pevycimjvo,$l_1$ is an implicitly metaphorical lujvo with meaning $l_2$ and arguments $l_3$ built from metaphor $l_4$.,Used to refer to metaphorical lujvo that do not contain any -pev- rafsi (for “{pe'a}”). The word “{cimjvo}” is an example of such a lujvo and synonymous to pevycimjvo.,lujvo,,,implicit metaphor
column95: pevypanje,$x_1$ is a coral of species $x_2$.,,lujvo,,,coral
column96: pevypinta,$x_1$ (organization/group/structure) is horizontal in metaphorical frame of reference $x_2$; $x_1$ lacks hierarchy/levels of membership of type $x_2$.,Contrasts with {pevysraji} 'vertical'/'hierarchical'.,lujvo,,,egalitarian,horizontal,horizontal structure,lacking hierarchy
column97: pevyplu,$x_1$ is like an island in a sea of $x_2$; $x_1$ is very distinct/foreign (in appearance, composition and/or behavior) from surroundings/environment/background $x_2$.,From {pe'a} {daplu}. Does not translate the English metaphor that to be an island is to be isolated. {jiksei}, {seicni}, and other words derived from {sepli} are better for this.,lujvo,,,distinct,distinguishable,foreign,foreign body,foreign object,stand out,stick out
column98: pevyselma'o,$x_1$ is the part-of-speech / grammatical class of word $x_2$, which means or has function $x_{3}$ in language $x_{4}$.,= {vlagenkle}; Generalization of {selma'o}, to be usable for non-cmavo and words from other languages. See {ma'oi},lujvo,,,part of speech
column99: pevysmacu,$x_1$ is a computer mouse with button/buttons $x_2$.,Mouse buttons: {se} pevysmacu (left: {zulselpevysmacu}, middle: {mijyselpevysmacu}), right: {prityselpevysmacu}); Mouse wheel: {pevysmacyxi'u}. See also: {samxa'e}.,lujvo,,,computer mouse,mouse
column100: pevysmacyki'e,$x_1$ is a mouse pad for mouse $x_2$ and is made of material $x_3$.,Cf. {pevysmacu}, {kicne}.,lujvo,,,mouse pad
column101: pevysmacyxi'u,$x_1$ is a mouse wheel of computer mouse $x_2$, and is made of materials/having properties $x_3$.,Cf. {mijyselpevysmacu}, {pevysmacu}.,lujvo,,,mouse wheel
column102: pevysme,$x_1$ reflects Middle-Eastern language/culture/nationality in aspect $x_2$.,See also {semto}.,lujvo,,,Middle Eastern,Middle-Eastern
column103: pevysoljme,$j_1$ is a sunstone/aventurine feldspar [gem/polished stone] of type $j_2$ from source $j_3$.,See also: {pevysolkunra}.,lujvo,,,aventurine feldspar,sunstone
column104: pevysolkunra,$k_1$ is a sunstone/aventurine feldspar [mineral] of type $k_2$ mined from source $k_3$.,See also: {pevysoljme}.,lujvo,,,aventurine feldspar,sunstone
column105: pevyca'o zei uidje,$c_1$=$u_1$ is a window of user interface $u_2$.,See {uidje}.,zei-lujvo,,,window
column106: pegnaka,$x_1$ is a PEG negative lookahead, matching when rule $x_2$ does not match,See {pegjva}, {pegnpe},fu'ivla,pegnaka,
column107: pegrcu'a,$x_1$ is a PEG ordered choice rule, matching and returning the result of the leftmost possible rule in sequence $x_2$,See {pegjva},fu'ivla,pegrcu'a,
column108: pegrpoi,$x_1$ is a PEG rule matching what sequence of rules $x_2$ matches and producing a sequence of the outputs of those rules,See {pegjva},fu'ivla,pegrpoi,
column109: pegrsu'e,$x_1$ is a PEG rule matching at most one repetition of rule $x_2$ and returning a sequence of any match results,See {pegjva}, {pegrke'u}, {pegrsu'o},fu'ivla,pegrsu'e,
column110: peizlemustei,$x_1$ pertains to Mousterian technological industry/culture/know-how of period and location (specifics) $x_2$ in properties $x_3$,,fu'ivla,peizlemustei,,Mousterian
column111: pelmeni,$x_1$ is a piece/pieces of dumplings/ravioli/pelmeni/dim sum (Hongkong/Xianggang cuisine) containing $x_2$,Cf. {nanba}, {rectu}, {sanmi},fu'ivla,pelmeni,,ravioli
column112: pelpeli,$x_1$ is black pepper of species/variety/cultivar $x_2$,,fu'ivla,pelpeli,
column113: pemcrlimriki,$x_1$ is a limerick about subject/theme $x_2$ by author $x_3$.,Cf. {pemci}, {pemcrxaiku}, {pemcrsoneto}.,fu'ivla,pemcrlimriki,,limerick
column114: pemcrsenru,$x_1$ is a senryū poem about subject/theme $x_2$ by author $x_3$.,Japanese "senryū" 川柳,fu'ivla,pemcrsenru,
column115: pemcrsoneto,$x_1$ is a sonnet about subject/theme $x_2$ by author $x_3$.,Cf. {pemci}, {pemcrxaiku}, {pemcrlimriki}.,fu'ivla,pemcrsoneto,,sonnet
column116: pemcrxaiku,$x_1$ is a haiku about subject/theme $x_2$ by author $x_3$.,Cf. {pemci}, {pemcrsoneto}, {pemcrlimriki}.,fu'ivla,pemcrxaiku,,haiku
column118: pemsuua,$x_1$ is a poem/piece of text with number $x_2$ (li) of $x_3$ (metrical foot) per line,See also {pemci}, {iambi}, {troxeii}, {anpesti}, {daktili},fu'ivla,pemsuua,,meter
column120: penmikani,$x_1$ is some pemmican with components $x_2$,See also {cidja}, {rectu}, {jbari},fu'ivla,penmikani,
column124: persika,$x_1$ is a peach of variety $x_2$,see also {flaume}, {rutrprunu},fu'ivla,persika,,peach
column125: persimo,$x_1$ is a persimmon/ebony of species/variety/cultivar $x_2$.,,fu'ivla,persimo,,ebony,persimmon
column126: pervuui,$x_1$ reflects Peruvian culture/nationality in aspect $x_2$.,Cf. {peRUV}, {ketco}, {gento}, {brazo}, {tcokumte}.,fu'ivla,pervuui,,Peruvian
column131: pe'ei,mark a logical connective as having maximal scope.,Etymologically derived from {pe'e} but is in BAhE. When placed before a logical connective, makes it so that it is evaluated at the very end, so that it is not blocked by abstractions or sub-bridi. For example: "mi viska lo nanmu .i je mi viska lo ninmu" -> "mi viska lo nanmu .e lo ninmu" -> "mi viska lo nanmu pe'ei je ninmu", not "mi viska lo nanmu je ninmu".,experimental cmavo,,,,BAhE
column132: pei'a,scalar / attitudinal question: how very...?,Essentially asks for NAI/CAI. For selbri/sumtcita, the full range of NAI/CAI may be asked for; see http://mw.lojban.org/papri/zipcpi:_scalar_modifiers and {pai'e}. For attitudinals, it is limited to {ru'e}/{na'oi}/{sai}/{cai} or combinations thereof (use {pei} to ask for the full range).,experimental cmavo,,,scalar question,CAI
column133: pei'e,evidential question: how do you know that?,Asks for UI2 (evidential) category, though a more detailed explanation may also be given.,experimental cmavo,,,evidential question,UI2
column134: pei'e'a,at-most-3-ary mekso operator: "integer exponent" for $X_1$ divided by $X_2$ in algebraic structure $X_3$,Produces the maximum integer $n$ such that $X_2 ^n | X_1$ in/according to the rules of $X_3$. $X_1$ and $X_2$ each must be nonzero and not units. Context or explicit specification elsewhere may make $X_3$ unnecessary. For natural numbers, the Wolfram Language calls this "IntegerExponent" (if we ignore the arity and the default specifications; but the argument order is preserved). In this case ($X_3 = (N, +, *)$, where "$N $" denotes the set of all natural numbers (positive integers)), this function can be usefully restricted to $f:(N$ Exclude Set$(1))$ Union $P -> N$ Union Set$(0),$ $(r,p) -> $max$($ Set$(n$ in $N$ Union Set$(0): p^n$ divides $r$ in $N))$, where "P" denotes the set of primes in the unique factorization domain of integers.,experimental cmavo,,,exponent of factors,integer exponent,VUhU
column135: pei'i'a,digit/number: Apéry's constant ζ(3) = 1.202056903159594285399738161511449990764986292…,,experimental cmavo,,,Apery's constant zeta(3),PA5
column136: pei'o,attitudinal category question: what is the category (UI4) of attitudinal?,Specifically asks about the UI4-category, either when attached to attitudinals or used alone. Valid answers include both the category on its own and a whole UI with additional specifiers (as long as the category is included). Of course, any relevant -nai or -cu'i of the category must be included in the answer.,experimental cmavo,,,attitudinal category ?,UI4

column2: peizlemustiei,$x1$ pertains to Mousterian technological industry/culture/know-how of period and location (specifics) $x2$ in properties $x3$,,obsolete fu'ivla,peizlemustiei,,Mousterian
column3: pe sai,restrictive relative phrase marker: semi-permanently associated to; will remain associated unless something breaks that relation,Proposed as a variation of {po} with less semantic-boundary difficulties, while freeing up {po} for reassignment in dialects/forks. Legal ownership is a possible relation; it could also mean, say, the chair assigned to you in an office, which will remain 'your' chair until reassigned, where mere {pe} could just mean the one you're sitting on. {do'e}{sai} could be a variation to associate a bridi or the subject of the bridi, e.g. 'ti stizu do'esai mi'. See {pecai}, {pe}, {ponse}, {po'a},cmavo-compound,,,semi-permanent association,GOI*
column4: pezli,$x_{1}$ is a leaf of plant $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is foliage of $x_{2}$.,See also {tricu}, {papri}, {spati}.,gismu,pez,pezl,pezli,,leaf
column5: picti,$x_{1}$ is a trillionth [$10^{-12}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).,Cf. {grake}, {mitre}, {snidu}, {stero}, {delno}, {molro}, {kelvo}, {xampo}, {gradu}, {litce}, {merli}, {centi}, {decti}, {dekto}, {femti}, {gigdo}, {gocti}, {gotro}, {kilto}, {megdo}, {mikri}, {milti}, {nanvi}, {petso}, {terto}, {xatsi}, {xecto}, {xexso}, {zepti}, {zetro}.,gismu,pic,pict,picti,,1E-12,trillionth
column6: pijne,$x_{1}$ is a pin/peg (needle-shaped tool) for fastening to/piercing $x_{2}$, of material/properties $x_{3}$.,See also {jesni}, {nivji}, {fenso}, {dinko}, {tutci}.,gismu,pijn,pijne,,pin
column7: pikci,$x_{1}$ begs/pleads/supplicates/entreats/implores/beseeches/prays [asks with humility] $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$.,Also importune, petition, plea, solicit; $x_2$ benefactor, patron; $x_3$ boon, favor, gift, alms. See also {cpedu} which is more general as to manner, {pindi}.,gismu,pikc,pikci,,beg
column8: pikta,$x_{1}$ is a ticket entitling $x_{2}$ to entitlement/privilege $x_{3}$ (event/state) under conditions $x_{4}$.,See also {jaspu}.,gismu,pikt,pikta,,ticket
column9: pilji,$x_{1}$ is the product/total/result of factors/multiplicands ($x_{2}$ and $x_{3}$) $x_{2}$ multiplied by $x_{3}$.,See also {mekso}, {sumji}, {rapli}, {jalge}, {dilcu}, {pi'i},gismu,pi'i,pilj,pilji,,multiply
column10: pilka,$x_{1}$ is a crust/rind/peel/skin/hide/outer cover of $x_{2}$.,(cf. {grute}, {calku}, {skapi} (pilka as a general term includes skapi), {gacri}),gismu,pil,pi'a,pilk,pilka,,crust
column11: pilno,$x_1$ uses/employs $x_2$ [tool, apparatus, machine, agent, acting entity, material] for purpose $x_3$.,Also utilize; $x_2$ is useful/used productively by $x_1$ to do $x_3$ (use {selpli} for reordered places); hire/employ (use {le'ipli}, {lejyplicu'a}).  (cf. {tutci}, {cabra}, {minji}, {gasnu}, {zukte} for $x_2$, cmavo list {pi'o}, {sazri}, {jibri}),gismu,pli,piln,pilno,,use,,pi'o,se pi'o,te pi'o
column12: pimlu,$x_{1}$ is a/the feather/plume(s)/plumage [body-part] of animal/species $x_{2}$.,See also {cipni}, {nalci}, {rebla}, {kerfa}, {penbi}.,gismu,pim,pi'u,piml,pimlu,,feather
column13: polje,$x_{1}$ (force) folds/creases $x_{2}$ at locus/loci/forming crease(s)/bend(s) $x_{3}$.,For agentive folding (= {plogau}, {plozu'e}); use cardinal-value sumti in $x_3$, or rapli, to indicate multiple folds.  See also {korcu}, {cinje}, {boxfo}, {boxna}.,gismu,plo,polj,polje,,fold
column14: polno,$x_{1}$ reflects Polynesian/Oceanian (geographic region) culture/nationality/languages in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {sralo}, {daplu}, {xamsi}.,gismu,pol,poln,polno,,Polynesian
column15: ponjo,$x_{1}$ reflects Japanese culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {xazdo}, {daplu}.,gismu,pon,po'o,ponj,ponjo,,Japanese
column16: ponse,$x_{1}$ possesses/owns/has $x_{2}$ under law/custom $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is owner/proprietor of $x_{2}$ under $x_{3}$.,($x_3$ is generally more important to the concept than commonly accepted for the English equivalent, since the concept is broader when unconstrained, and the nature/interpretation of possession/ownership is very culturally dependent); See also {ckini}, {ralte}, {jitro}, {steci}, {srana}, {tutra}, {turni}, {zivle}.,gismu,pos,po'e,pons,ponse,,possess,,po'a
column18: porsi,$x_{1}$ [ordered set] is sequenced/ordered/listed by comparison/rules $x_{2}$ on unordered set $x_{3}$.,Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is serial.  (sets are completely specified); See also cmavo list {po'i}, {lidne}, {liste}, {cmima}.,gismu,por,poi,pors,porsi,,sequence,,po'i,se po'i,te po'i
column19: porto,$x_{1}$ reflects Portuguese culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {brazo}.,gismu,pot,port,porto,,Portuguese
column20: prali,$x_{1}$ is a profit/gain/benefit/advantage to $x_{2}$ accruing/resulting from activity/process $x_{3}$.,Also (fe) $x_2$ profits from $x_3$ (= {selterprali} for reordered places); $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {selposprali} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {vecnu}, {cnemu}, {pleji}, {jinga}, {canja}, {sfasa}, {jerna}, {jdima}, {dunda}, {zivle}.,gismu,pal,pral,prali,,gain,profit
column21: prami,$x_{1}$ loves/feels strong affectionate devotion towards $x_{2}$ (object/state).,Also: $x_1$ is loving towards $x_2$, $x_1$ is a lover of $x_2$ (one sense), $x_2$ is beloved by $x_1$ (= {selpa'i} for reordered places).  See also {cinmo}, {xebni}, {nelci}, {djica}, {sinma}, {pluka}, {kurji}, {pendo}, {speni}.,gismu,pam,pa'i,pram,prami,,love
column22: prane,$x_{1}$ is perfect/ideal/archetypical/faultless/flawless/un-improvable in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka).,Also without defect/error.  See also {manfo}, {curve}, {traji}, {cfila}, {mulno}.,gismu,pa'e,pran,prane,,ideal,perfect
column23: preja,$x_{1}$ spreads/expands over/into $x_{2}$ from initial state $x_{3}$.,See also {tcena}, {kuspe}, {ranji}, {fatri}, {muvdu}, {benji}.,gismu,pej,pe'a,prej,preja,,spread
column24: prenu,$x_{1}$ is a person/people (noun) [not necessarily human]; $x_{1}$ displays personality/a persona.,See also {nanmu}, {ninmu}, {remna}, {zukte}, {sevzi}.,gismu,pre,pren,prenu,,people,person
column25: preti,$x_{1}$ (quoted text) is a question/query about subject $x_{2}$ by questioner $x_{3}$ to audience $x_{4}$.,See also {nabmi}, {danfu}, {ciksi}, {frati}, {spuda}, {cpedu}.,gismu,ret,rei,pret,preti,,question
column26: prije,$x_{1}$ is wise/sage about matter $x_{2}$ (abstraction) to observer $x_{3}$.,See also {bebna}.,gismu,pij,prij,prije,,wise
column27: prina,$x_{1}$ is a print/impression/image on/in surface $x_{2}$ of/made by/using tool/press/implement/object $x_{3}$.,See also {cukta}, {papri}, {pelji}, {pixra}, {ciska}, {danre}, {barna}.,gismu,pri,prin,prina,,print
column28: pritu,$x_{1}$ is to the right/right-hand side of $x_{2}$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $x_{3}$.,Also: $x_3$ is the standard of orientation for $x_2$.  See also cmavo list {ri'u}, {mlana}, {crane}, {trixe}, {farna}, {zunle}.,gismu,prit,pritu,,right
column29: prosa,$x_{1}$ is prose about plot/theme/subject $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$ for intended audience $x_{4}$.,Non-poetic written text, without intentional rhyme or meter; $x_2$ may be a convention rather than a subject.  See also {cfika}, {lisri}, {cukta}, {pemci}, {finti}.,gismu,ros,ro'a,pros,prosa,,prose
column30: pruce,$x_{1}$ is a process with inputs $x_{2}$, outputs/results $x_{3}$, passing through steps/stages $x_{4}$.,$x_2$ resource (= {selru'e}, but also {ru'etci}, (ru'er-/ruc- or selru'e-/selruc- modifying:) selxaksu, selsabji, livla).  See also cmavo list {pu'e}, {farvi}, {tadji}, {grute}, {tcini}.,gismu,ruc,ru'e,pruc,pruce,,course,process,,pu'e,se pu'e,te pu'e,ve pu'e
column32: pruxi,$x_{1}$ is spiritual/pertains to the soul in nature [either energy or being]; $x_{1}$ is ghostly/ethereal.,Also soul (= {ruxse'i}).  See also {censa}, {lijda}, {mucti}, {xadni}.,gismu,rux,ru'i,prux,pruxi,,spirit
column33: pulce,$x_{1}$ is dust/precipitate [suspensible solid] from $x_{2}$ in medium/on surface $x_{3}$.,See also te {zalvi}, {danmo}, {purmo}, {sligu}.,gismu,puc,pu'e,pulc,pulce,,dust,precipitate

column35: pi'a,n-ary mathematical operator: operands are vectors to be treated as matrix rows.,,cmavo,,,matrix of rows,VUhU4
column36: pi'e,digit/number:separates digits for base >16, not current standard, or variable (e.g. time, date).,,cmavo,,,digit separator,PA3
column37: pi'i,n-ary mathematical operator: times; multiplication operator; [(((a * b) * c) * ...)].,see also {pilji}, {fe'i},cmavo,,,times,VUhU1
column38: po'o,discursive: uniquely, only, solely: the only relevant case.,See also {pamei}, {mulno}, {frica}.,cmavo,,,uniquely,UI3b
column39: po'u,restrictive appositive phrase marker: which is the same thing as.,,cmavo,,,restrictive identity,GOI
column40: pu,time tense relation/direction: did [selbri]; before/prior to [sumti]; default past tense.,,cmavo,,,before,PU
column41: pu'a,{pluka} modal, 1st place                            pleased by ...,,cmavo,,,pleased by,BAI
column42: pu'e,{pruce} modal, 1st place (in manner 1)              by process ...,,cmavo,,,by process,BAI
column43: pu'i,modal aspect: can and has; demonstrated potential.,,cmavo,pus,,can and has,CAhA
column44: poplu,$x_1$ is poplar / aspen / cottonwood (plant of genus Populus) of species $x_2$,See also {spati}, {tricu},experimental gismu,poplu,,aspen,cottonwood,poplar
column45: porno,$x_1$ is pornography of sexual orientation $x_2$ in presentation/medium $x_3$ of specialty/specialization/concentration/focus $x_4$,,experimental gismu,porno,
column46: premi,$x_1$ is the principal/chief/main/boss/primary/premier in aspect/organizational principle/role $x_2$ (ka) in organization/system $x_3$.,This is much like $tervipsi$ except that it does not imply the existence of any subordinate/deputy. So the Presidency is an office which may fill $x_2$ in this word or {vipsi}; here it produces what is normally called the President ($x_1$) but there, it produces the Vice-President. This allows for abbreviations such as "(A)(V)P(E)otUS", but brings symmetry between VP and P, allowing also for strings with variable characters which allow the referent to range over the possibilities (offices) more easily (rather than reminding people that a null character is possible), such as with "XPotUS", wherein "X" is variable and thus the string can refer to the PotUS or the VPotUs (and possibly those with "A" concatenated to their fronts).,experimental gismu,premi,
column47: preri,$x_1$ is a non-binary parent of $x_2$ [not necessarily biological].,See discussion associated with "{dinti}" concerning whether this meaning is restricted to "affirmatively nonbinary" or whether it is more general. Specifies "{rirni}" so as to be co-equal to but neither "{patfu}" nor "{mamta}". See also: "{dinti}", "{rirni}", "{mamta}", "{patfu}", "{nunmu}".,experimental gismu,preri,,non-binary parent
column48: proga,$x_1$ is a program, computer application for doing $x_2$ (clause),See also {skami}, {tutci}. Proposed rafsi -pog-,experimental gismu,pog,proga,,computer application,program
column49: proji,$x_1$ makes program $x_2$ using language $x_3$ for computer $x_4$ and for purpose $x_5$; $x_1$ is a programmer,,experimental gismu,proji,,program
column51: pevysraji,$x_1$ (organization/group/structure) is vertical/hierarchical in metaphorical frame of reference $x_2$; $x_1$ has hierarchy/levels of membership of type $x_2$.,Contrasts with {pevypinta} 'horizontal'. Synonyms: {pevysetkai}, {kamvlisetkai}, {vlikamzmakai}.,lujvo,,,hierarchical,vertical
column53: pevzifrokpre,$x_1$ is a Freemason which is a member of lodge $x_2$, which belongs to grand lodge $x_3$.,,lujvo,,,Freemason
column54: pexfebdja,$x_1$=$p_1$=$c_1$ is a noodle/pasta/boiled dough eaten by $x_2$=$c_2$ made out of $x_3$=$p_2$ (normally grain(s) or legume(s)) which is boiled in $x_4$=$f_1$ (normally water) at temperature $x_5$=$f_2$ and pressure $x_6$=$f_3$,See also {febjukpa}, {grupesxu}.  luvjo from {pesxu}, {febvi}, {cidja}.  Not very jvajvo, but it works.,lujvo,,,fusilli,macaroni,pasta,penne,shaped pasta
column55: pexsalta,$s_1$ (mass) is a quantity of bound salad [salad assembled with thick sauces] with ingredients/components including $k_1$=$s_2$ (mostly fresh leafy vegetables).,,lujvo,,,bound salad
column56: pextamca,$t_1$ is a plum/paste tomato of variety/strain $t_2$.,,lujvo,,,paste tomato,plum tomato
column57: pezri'oxu'i,$x_1$ is chlorophyll of type $x_2$; $x_1$ is chlorophyllous with type $x_2$,,lujvo,,,chlorophyll,chlorophyllous
column58: pezyfaltricu,$t_1$ is a deciduous tree of species $t_2$.,Cf. {ze'erpezytricu}.,lujvo,,,deciduous,deciduous tree

column66: pifcpi,$x_1$ is a hornbill of species $x_2$.,,lujvo,,,hornbill

column71: pi'izma,$x_1$ exceeds $x_2$ is aspect $x_3$ (ka/ni) by factor $x_4$; $x_1$ is/does $x_3$ $x_4$ times as much as $x_2$ is/does.,Not exactly jvajvo. See {pilji}, {zmadu}.,lujvo,,,as much

column75: piljy'efku,$x_1$=$efku_1$=$pilji_1$ is $x_2$=$efku_2$=$pilji_2$ * $x_4$ * $x_4$ * $x_4$ * ... * $x_4$, multiplied $x_3$=$efku_3$ times, with multiplier $x_4$=$pilji_3$; $x_1$ = $x_2$ * ($x_4^{x_3}$),,lujvo,,

column81: pimdu'i,$d_1$=$p_2$ has the same feathers/plumage as $d_2$, the feathers/plumage being $p_1$.,Cf. {pimlu}, {dunli}.,lujvo,,,feathered identically,of a feather,with the same plumage
column82: pimpenbi,$x_1$ is a quill/plume/feather-pen using ink $x_2$, applied by process $x_3$, with feather being from individual/species $x_4$,,lujvo,,,quill

column94: popkurmo'a,$x_1$ is a houndstooth (broken checks/quadrilaterals) pattern composed of "teeth" $x_2$ arranged in structure $x_3$,,lujvo,,,houndstooth

column99: porfa'o,$x_1$ is a subsequence of $x_2$ located at the end of $x_2$ and $x_3$ elements long,{porsi}, {fanmo}, {pormoi}, {moi},lujvo,,
